response:
The patient presents with subacute unilateral visual impairment (6/18 acuity) and a Relative Afferent Pupillary Defect (RAPD) in the left eye. These are distinct hallmarks of an optic neuropathy. While there are subtle motor findings (4+/5 left wrist extension and right ankle dorsiflexion), these are non-localising to a single pathway and may represent early multifocal demyelination or be effort-dependent; the definitive and clinically dominant lesion is in the anterior visual pathway.

lesion_locations = ["Left Optic Nerve"]
